p: In a study by Finiuk et al., new N-acylated-2-amino-5-benzyl-1,3-thiazoles were prepared and assessed for their in vitro anticancer activity. The selectivity of tested compounds against glioblastoma and melanoma were proved in MTT assay and among these compounds, compound 11 demonstrating a selective action towards the human glioblastoma U251 cells and human melanoma WM793 cells, comparing to the leukemia cells. Meantime, these compounds created low toxicity to pseudo-normal cells (Fig. 4) [ 39].
